aws::graph::propositions: # Bell 407 Helicopter Accident Information
The accident involved a Bell 407 helicopter.
The defining event was a collision during takeoff/land.
The pilot was a 27-year-old male.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot did not have airplane ratings.
The pilot had helicopter ratings.
The pilot had an instrument rating for helicopters.
The pilot did not have instructor ratings.
The pilot held a Class 2 medical certificate without waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on January 25, 2012.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on November 13, 2012.
The pilot had 2750 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 200 hours in the Bell 407 helicopter.
The pilot had 2700 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 51 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 20 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 4 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
No second pilot was present during the accident.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The aircraft was a Bell 407 helicopter with no series designation.
The aircraft registration was N489AE.
The aircraft serial number was 54059.
The aircraft had a normal airworthiness certificate.
The aircraft was manufactured in an unknown year.
The aircraft was not amateur built.
The aircraft had high skid landing gear.
The aircraft had 3 seats.
The aircraft's last inspection was on December 3, 2012, as an Approved Aircraft Inspection Program (AAIP).
The aircraft's certified maximum gross weight was 5250 pounds.
The aircraft had 780 total airframe hours at the time of the accident.
The aircraft had one turbo shaft engine.
The aircraft engine was manufactured by Rolls Royce.
The engine model was 250-C47B.
The engine was rated at 674 horsepower.
The aircraft had an Emergency Locator Transmitter (ELT) installed but not activated.
The registered owner of the aircraft was Capital Source Bank.
The operator of the aircraft was Air Evac EMS.
The operator held an on-demand air taxi (135) operating certificate.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
Takeoff | Collision during takeoff/land (Defining event)

## Pilot Information
Certificate: | Commercial
Age: | 27,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | None
Seat Occupied: | Right
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter
Restraint Used: |
Instrument Rating(s): | Helicopter
Second Pilot Present: | No
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 2 Without waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | January 25, 2012
Occupational Pilot: | Yes
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | November 13, 2012
Flight Time: | 2750 hours (Total, all aircraft), 200 hours (Total, this make and model), 2700 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 51 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 20 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 4 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

## Aircraft and Owner/Operator Information
Aircraft Make: | Bell
Registration: | N489AE
Model/Series: | 407 NO SERIES
Aircraft Category: | Helicopter
Year of Manufacture: | Amateur Built:
Airworthiness Certificate: | Normal
Serial Number: | 54059
Landing Gear Type: | High skid
Seats: | 3
Date/Type of Last Inspection: | December 3, 2012 AAIP
Certified Max Gross Wt.: | 5250 lbs
Time Since Last Inspection: | Engines: 1 Turbo shaft
Airframe Total Time: | 780 Hrs at time of accident
Engine Manufacturer: | Rolls Royce
ELT: | Installed, not activated
Engine Model/Series: | 250-C47B
Registered Owner: | Capital Source Bank
Rated Power: | 674 Horsepower
Operator: | Air Evac EMS
Operating Certificate(s) Held: | On-demand air taxi (135)

---
